intro: Psychotria gabrieliae, commonly known as the Gabriel's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. The plant has also been studied for its potential chemical compounds, which may have medicinal properties.
